android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETE.description: Allows an application to start itself as soon as the system has finished booting. This can make it take longer to start the phone and allow the application to slow down the overall phone by always running.

android.permission.SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW.description: Allows an application to show system-alert windows. Malicious applications can take over the entire screen of the phone.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate

Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.
Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.
Certificate algorithm vulnerable to hash collision

manifest_findings.title:
App can be installed on a vulnerable unpatched Android version
Android 4.0.3-4.0.4, [minSdk=15]
manifest_findings.description: This application can be installed on an older version of android that has multiple unfixed vulnerabilities. These devices won't receive reasonable security updates from Google. Support an Android version => 10, API 29 to receive reasonable security updates.
manifest_findings.name: App can be installed on a vulnerable unpatched Android version 4.0.3-4.0.4, [minSdk=15]

manifest_findings.title:
Debug Enabled For App
[android:debuggable=true]
manifest_findings.description: Debugging was enabled on the app which makes it easier for reverse engineers to hook a debugger to it. This allows dumping a stack trace and accessing debugging helper classes.
manifest_findings.name: Debug Enabled For App [android:debuggable=true]

manifest_findings.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup] flag is missing.
manifest_findings.description: The flag [android:allowBackup] should be set to false. By default it is set to true and allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_findings.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup] flag is missing.

manifest_findings.title:
Broadcast Receiver (.BootCompleteReceiver) is not Protected.
An intent-filter exists.
manifest_findings.description: A Broadcast Receiver is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. The presence of intent-filter indicates that the Broadcast Receiver is explicitly exported.
manifest_findings.name: Broadcast Receiver .BootCompleteReceiver is not Protected.An intent-filter exists.

high.title: Application vulnerable to Janus Vulnerability
high.description: Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

high.title: Certificate algorithm vulnerable to hash collision
high.description: Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.

high.title: App can be installed on a vulnerable unpatched Android version
high.description:
Android 4.0.3-4.0.4, [minSdk=15]
This application can be installed on an older version of android that has multiple unfixed vulnerabilities. These devices won't receive reasonable security updates from Google. Support an Android version => 10, API 29 to receive reasonable security updates.

high.title: Debug Enabled For App
high.description:
[android:debuggable=true]
Debugging was enabled on the app which makes it easier for reverse engineers to hook a debugger to it. This allows dumping a stack trace and accessing debugging helper classes.

warning.title: Application Data can be Backed up
warning.description:
[android:allowBackup] flag is missing.
The flag [android:allowBackup] should be set to false. By default it is set to true and allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.

warning.title: Broadcast Receiver (.BootCompleteReceiver) is not Protected.
warning.description:
An intent-filter exists.
A Broadcast Receiver is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. The presence of intent-filter indicates that the Broadcast Receiver is explicitly exported.

secure.title: This application has no privacy trackers
secure.description: This application does not include any user or device trackers. Unable to find trackers during static analysis.

hotspot.title: Found 1 critical permission(s)
hotspot.description:
Ensure that these permissions are required by the application.

android.permission.SYSTEM_ALERT_WINDOW (dangerous): display system-level alerts - Allows an application to show system-alert windows. Malicious applications can take over the entire screen of the phone.
